instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3S: What is PP3V3_G3S? PP3V3_G3S is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3S standby state. .
definitions.P3V3G3S_EN: What is P3V3G3S_EN? P3VG3S_EN is a signal that turns on the PP3V3_G3S power rail. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 20v no display
threads.message:
Hi. MacBook looks perfect, no water, no drop, nothing bad on motherboard. I've tried DFU, no luck (Dfu starts up but doesn't help). Processor heats up.

L9060 - 2.5v
L7670 - 5.1v
L7690 - 3.3v
L7030 - 12.6v
L7400 - 1.8v
L7230  - 0v, 0.3 ohm
L7220 - 0v, 0.3 ohm
L7210 - 0v, 0.3 ohm
L8100 - 1.1v
L8410 - 0v 270 kohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 20v no display
threads.message:
Compare resistance to ground on CPU coils with good board.

Check L7701 voltage and all outputs from page 66 too.

Unfortunately, I don't have the same motherboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 20v no display
threads.message:
Don't make confusion between a power rail and its enable signal!

What error do you get on DFU?
SSD voltages try to appear?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 20v no display
threads.message:
Tried revive 2x. Seems to complete, there is no error message,  a reboot and a lock symbol on the bad device's DFU icon. CPU still no volt.
<SIGNAL>P1V8SSD_SW0</SIGNAL> 1.8V 
<SIGNAL>P0V9SSD_SW0</SIGNAL> 0.9v 
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> 2.5v
<SIGNAL>PPVCCQ_ANI_SSD0</SIGNAL> 1.8v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 20v no display
threads.message:
I suspect bad CPU.
Check if L8150 gets voltage too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 20v no display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 20v no display
threads.message:
Is it a bad CPU ?
Is it worth rebalancing the CPU ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 20v no display
threads.message: If CPU is really shorted on its core power, must be changed, not reballed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 20v no display
threads.message: Is there anything else that can be done ?
